results.description:
By 2020, NOAA, NASA, other governmental agencies, will collect and publish over an Exabyte of climate data each year, confronting scientists, economists, policy makers, and businesses with enormous challenges in analyzing this data and relating it to everyday decisions. Climate Change hurts the weak and poor exponentially harder than the strong and rich. That's true for nations, communities, and families. The accumulation of Climate Data will increasingly allow Data Scientists to discover early warning signs of climate changes that will effect vulnerable populations.

This Meetup Group is established to develop the methodologies, skills, and capabilities to discover leading data indicators of social impacts of climate change and their tertiary consequences for communities, governments, and businesses. The goal is to pro-actively identify risks and mitigate before exposure become too large to control.

The geographical scope of this group is global.  You can join no matter where you live and you can become a co-organizer and organize meetups and other activities wherever your community is located.
results.name: Climate Data Meetup

This group is for those that are interested in getting together and having that discussion.

Until now, we have operated privately through small exclusive networks of researchers, female entrepreneurs, and female economists. Our Affiliates range from public figures to large organizations. We urge women to take advantage. Join us today to receive real resources and special gifts at our next event.

results.description: "So when I get old you'll take of me....right?" With the mortality rate increasing and medical science getting better and better as time goes by people are begining to live much longer then ever before. But when we get older, and need assistance with daily living activities, are we going to want to place the responsibility for our care on the shoulders of our loved ones? It's not just hands-on care: 8 percent of baby boomers, 13 percent of Generation X and 19 percent of millennials are financially supporting a parent, to the tune of $12,000 a year, according to a survey of 1,000 adults released this summer from TD Ameritrade. Of those, 31 percent said they are also caregivers for that parent. From 2012 to 2050, the Census Bureau projects, the size of the U.S. population age 65 and older will nearly double. The ranks of the so-called "old old," those 85-plus, will more than triple over that period. Among adults age 51 to 54, 82.8 percent are currently "at risk" of needing to provide care for a parent or in-law due to health concerns, according to a 2014 report from The Urban Institute. Yet paid care is out of reach for many. Please come down on November 17th to the New York Life building in Lake Success, NY and attend a free educational workshop on long term care and the many options that are available for us to avoid creating any future hardships for our family members Feel free to contact me for any further information 516-359-8696 Anyone interested in learning about long term care is welcome to join. Please RSVP as soon as you can and reserve your seats!
results.name: New York Long Term Care Meetup

Some of my favorite memories involve being outdoors, camping, Skiing, Biking, Swimming, Beaching, indoor rock Climbing, Hiking, Traveling and exploring the world.
New activities to try include fishing, survival skills, Surfing, kayaking etc. Don't be intimidated we will go slow and accommodate newbies. All you need is a desire to try new things.

But in a sea of 100 outdoor and adventure enthusiasts 5% might be black or of color if you're lucky. There has to be folks like me out there who get turned on by the scent of firewood or are transported by breathing deeply outdoors (Not in the city). 

This group is for you, let's come together, build a fun and open community and promote black people doing non-traditional things. We'll do trips together and eat each other's food -- It will be great! Open to people of color aka black, latino.... We will not turn you away if you feel an affinity to the group. 

This will be an open, positive environment--No cliques but bring the attitude, personality and outdoor spirit.

Note: Profile photo must show you, not furniture or a flower or your spirit animal!

Join Us - See You outside!

Read More (Heres some hilarious and insightful articles I found while searching the topic)

• Cypher Avenue: Why Don’t Black People Like the Great Outdoors?

• Brandon Harris: Why Is Camping a White Thing? A Few Wild Theories 

You'll also want to join our Private Fb Group to chat and get to know other members aka your new squadmates better.


COME ON IN

topics.name: Haiti Disaster Relief and Recovery Assistance
Let's Run and Donate to Aid the Haiti Survivors

results.description:
Come to the Upper East Side for dinner and bottomless drinks on a spacious terrace overlooking Central Park! This is a one-time event to raise money for a school in Jacmel, Haiti.

In September 2010, I traveled to Haiti as a volunteer to help with recovery efforts after the country was rocked by a 7.0 magnitude earthquake. I stayed in Jacmel, teaching remedial French classes and working on construction projects. My first week there, I took a basic Haitian Creole lesson, taught by a young man named Fanel Leme. He was a great teacher, and we became friends over the course of my time there. He would hang out with the volunteers outside of class and take us around the city, exposing us to life in Jacmel we would have otherwise missed. He was a great friend and ambassador to Haitian culture.

Now Fanel is pursuing his passion for education, starting a daycare in his hometown, Eagle Kindergarten. In a place where a lot of children are left roaming the streets while their parents eke out a living, his school is an invaluable service to the community. Everything Fanel has accomplished so far is a testament to how resourceful he is: he's built a classroom, and provided uniforms and supplies, all from his own pockets and donations. He recently reached out to me and asked if I would be able to help him build a kitchen for the kids. Sadly, most of them don't get packed lunches from their parents/caregivers before they're sent off to school. Having meals at school would be a huge leap for their education and overall health.

The goal of this dinner is to raise the funds necessary to finish the construction of Eagle Kindergarten’s kitchen. The cost per guest is will be minimum donation of $40. As I said at the top, there’s going to be delicious food, bottomless drinks, and music, all in a spacious apartment with a large terrace overlooking Central Park – perfect ingredients for a great time, especially when it’s for a good cause!

Here are some links to the gofundme page I started for Eagle Kindergarten, and Fanel's facebook page for the school:

https://www.gofundme.com/6v4yz5bj

https://www.facebook.com/groups/88249510184...

Also, you can take care of the donation when you arrive for the dinner on Saturday, or you can get it out of the way now and I'll take note of which guests have already donated prior to the event.
results.name: Fundraising dinner for Haitian school

The goal for MinorityTechnology Careers is to create a dynamic community of like-minded minority technology professionals, innovators and enthusiasts who are working with or interested in existing, new and emerging technologies. We’re talking the whole techie gamut from bloggers, digital media specialists, community managers and web masters to web designers, social media strategists, developers, online marketing experts, recruiters, software developers, project managers, IT managers, system architects, engineers and administrators. 
        And of course the doors are wide open for those folks who are simply just passionate about all things technical. 
        Minority Technology Careers will meet regularly at least once a month for fun socializing and high level talks on various technology topics and ways to further enhance out careers.. We plan to feature educational meetups to learn the latest technical developments in a wide array of technologies. We also look forward to host joint events with many of the multitude of great tech groups based in New York City and beyond. 
        MTC also plans to participate in local startup events and help bring together New York based developers, tech entrepreneurs and venture capitalists for possible business opportunities. 
We feel this will be an excellent venue to exchange ideas and talk about technology, innovation, open source, share our knowledge and experience with one another. Tell us how technology is changing the world. Any minority interested in technology is welcome!

We advocate for the dignity, respect, and agency of all human beings—particularly the vulnerable, differently-abled, or marginalized. We embrace kindness as a core value and hope to enhance the lives of PWD, loved ones, and caregivers by:

• sharing stories and resources
• learning from guest speakers*
• exploring new technologies
• developing tools or products

We know you’re out there and how it feels to fare alone.

Let’s unite, interact, and make this Gerination great!

results.description: Cize it up with Rachel, is all about making that choice to become a more fit and healthy you!! Cize changed my life in ways you can't imagine, and I want to share that journey and help you reach your goals, while I continue to reach mine! So a little about Cize!! This is a dance based workout so you're just moving, having fun and it doesn't feel like exercise at all. Before you know it, you're drenched in sweat and you're working muscle groups in your body that you didn’t realize even existed. Over a total of 6 months I have lost 86 pounds. The results are incredible. I've never had more fun "working out" because I look forward to it every day. It's a very liberating program, because you're doing things in the moment feeling free, laughing, and having so much fun. Emotionally I'm in a completely different state of mind and that's what makes the difference the most. When you let go of the fear and doubt, you have that feeling that your fitness goals are actually achievable.
results.name: Cize It Up with Rachel

results.description:
Learn from the source! 

Join a group of local enthusiasts and train with a reputed international Taiji Master (Master Wang Feng-Ming) who makes a weekly trip from Edison NJ to conduct a class in Stamford, CT. Master Wang Feng-Ming is an internationally reputed martial arts master specializing in Taiji, Qigong, and Baguazhang, and also a renowned writer in martial arts. He is the author of several books (in Chinese and a few in English) and has published more than 100 articles in martial arts magazines around the world. More than 20 martial arts organizations in various parts of the world have appointed Master Wang as honorary institute director, professor, or consultant. 

Master Wang is a disciple of Grand Master Feng Zhiqiang, the 10th generation successor to Chen Style Taijiquan. He is also a disciple of Liu Xinghan, the 4th generation successor to Baquazhang. Master Wang started martial arts training and practice at age eight in China. He has studied and taught martial arts for several decades, and won many awards in China and international martial arts and qigong competition. He is reputed as the "King of Neigong" and Master of Taiji and Qigong. 

Chen Style Hun Yuan Taiji Teaching Program 

• Taiji Quan Form - 24, 48, 83 (Yi Lu)

• Taiji Push Hands 

• The Form and application for Attack and Defense 

• Taiji Weapons 

• Taiji Eight Methods 

• Many Kinds of Taiji Power 

Feel free to join us for a trial session to see if it suits!  We always look forward to meeting fellow enthusiasts and new friends.

Tuition:

Core class ($120 for four sessions a month)  3:30 to 4:30 Old frame

Core class and push hands (Total $150 for four sessions a month)  Add 4:30 to 5:30pm Push Hands

Full class (Total $180 for four sessions) Add 5:30 to 6:00pm Sword form
results.name: Stamford, CT - Chen Style Hun Yuan Taiji Meetup

results.description:
CommonTruce serves as a platform for professional people of color to unite in key aspects of life. 

It is actively turning strangers into friends and creating a network that will span across the country. Although it serves multiple functions, its main focus is to re-establish communication between men and women of color. Fostering healthier relationships will benefit us all personally in every aspect of life.

Do you aspire to connect with others?

CommonTruce Social acts as a bridge that draws men and women of color together. With a focus on re-establishing communication, resolution to our issues will be addressed in different ways. CommonTruce Dating and Relationship Q&A serves as a platform for us to address the issues that plague us as a community. Tabernacle Tuesdays #Preach is a podium to share monumental events in your personal lives to help prevent others from repeating the same mistakes. These prime events, in addition to local wine tastings, comedy shows, happy hours and other entertainment activities, compose the social experience which brings us together.

Do you desire change in your community?

CommonTruce Community is geared towards building the community we all envision. In order to generate any change, we have to play an active role. CommonTruce: Professional Dress Workshop has become a staple to educate young men of color on grooming, hygiene, and presentation. Each city will form working relationships with local programs, such as Bread for the City, Boys & Girls Club, Habitat for Humanity, assist in volunteer efforts and support where the need is great.

Do you possess an interest in traveling?

CommonTruce Travel affords the opportunity for individuals interested in traveling to do so with others. Whether it’s a quick weekend getaway to the beach or a lavish 5-day international voyage, we all need to maintain balance as working adults. There is nothing wrong with enjoying your downtime with like-minded young professionals.

Anything else I need to know before I join CommonTruce?

Membership does not hinge on your relationship status, ethnic origin or which aspect intrigues you most. What is sought after is your active participation in any of the areas you care to be involved in. The mission speaks for itself: CommonTruce is more than a social group..it's a movement.
results.name: CommonTruce NYC

topics.name: Self-Empowerment for Business and Personal Growth

results.description:
Have you ever so badly wanted to transform an area of your life - whether with your health, a relationship, your finances, or perhaps something within you - but the transformation never came to be? 

Despite how much you desired it and the fact that you did everything in your power to make it happen - the morning & evening affirmations, meditations, visualizations, living in the warrior mode of “do or die I’m gonna have It" - the change never came and if it did… it took you weeks, months, and years of sweat, tears, and struggle? 

Have you ever felt powerless because, truly, you feel you’ve done everything you possibly can and yet the road to your freedom and aliveness is no where in sight? Or worse, the road is in sight, but it’s a treacherous obstacle course that has no finish line. 

If you’re facing this right now, I hold the utmost compassion for you from a place of having been there myself. And having been there I know that despite what you’re living right now and how you’re feeling in this moment, somewhere within you is a very strong faith that there is something better, a faster way, an easier way… a knowing that change doesn't have to be so hard.

After all, why should it be? Aren’t you an extension of the higher power you believe in, a piece of what has made up this entire universe? As that, shouldn’t you be able to mold your own universe, your own life, into whatever you choose? With as little struggle and as much fun as you would if you were placing an order and selecting what you wanted from a catalog? 

Yes you are, and yes you can. 

The truth is that the voice within you, the one that’s always known and the one that’s always guiding you - perhaps even to these words right now - is right. The road to whatever transformation you are in search of is an ACCELERATED one- or it can be given the right mentor and the right tools. From my heart to yours, I invite you to experience first-hand how accelerated the transformation that’s been calling you can be. 

I decided to start this group because as a master coach and successful entrepreneur, I notice so many people (including myself at one point in time) in what I call the “hamster wheel” of never achieving their goals, where it seems to them that they never will or worse that their experience of getting there is such a struggle that they rob themselves from the joy of the process. It hurts me to see this as so many people's experience, just as much as it hurt me to experience it once myself... and it just doesn’t have to be this way. 

The purpose of this meet up is for you to discover and uncover what within you is truly holding you back and be given the tools on how to transform that in the most accelerated way. I'll be sharing a way for you to literally shift your existing reality to the one you desire - immediately. I'm sure you’ve heard that many times before, but the difference this time is that I’m not "just saying this to you"… I’m claiming this for you and inviting you to claim this for yourself. 

What gives me the right to claim that? Because it’s what I’ve DONE with my own life and now it's what I so deeply want for yours. Earlier this year, it was my own voice within that guided me to receiving these tools from my mentor which ended up being THE biggest quantum shift of my life - I tell you, as I’m writing this my heart is beating so fast with the truth that I do not even recognize myself! It is from this place that a fire within me exists to personally guide you to through your own experience of that. 

The very tools that I was given to use for my own accelerated evolution are the very tools that you are being offered right now. I invite you to come find out what those are! Talk is cheap and your personal experience of what I’m sharing with you is stronger than any of my words. Once you get to know me, you’ll learn that I’m not about the fluff, but rather the real “how to’s” to arrive at the transformation you’re looking for... and it's my greatest fulfillment to provide that for you. 

Therefore, these meet-ups are FREE… you have nothing to lose and more than you could ever imagine to gain. 

So, are you ready? Are you ready to experience accelerated growth? Don’t you deserve a life that’s alive with everything you desire - the financial freedom, soul partner, best friends, optimal health, the strongest connection to yourself, to the universe - aren’t you worth it ALL? 

Follow the voice within you that is screaming YES and that has resonated with every word. 

Join me and this beautiful family of Acceleration Transformationists. Your life will never be the same. From the bottom of my heart, I’m SO excited to meet you and to support you! 

To Our Collective Success and With All of My Love, 

Talia
results.name: Accelerated Transformation Mentoring

results.description:
I REALIZE PRIVACY IS IMPORTANT, THIS GROUP IS PRIVATE SO ONLY CURRENT GROUP MEMBERS CAN SEE OTHER MEMBERS OF THE GROUP & MEMBERSHIP MUST ALSO BE APPROVED BY ME


Do you feel your romantic life is not meeting its full potential?  Ever wonder about dating other people without compromising your current relationship?  Do you think your other half might have roaming eyes or is seeking companionship outside your relationship and want to talk about it? Or are you curious about being with more than one person romantically (not necessarily physically) at the same time?


Well, this group is a safe place to explore and discuss all those possibilities in a healthy and respectable manner! Polyamory is on the rise as people learn to take back their power & choose to be real about what they want in relationships vs going about it secretly. I am a happily married polyamory advocate with 9 years of experience. It truly has been a rewarding journey & I want to share my wisdom with women who might be in the same polycurious boat I found myself in years ago. 

We'll watch poly centered shows/movies & have group discussions. For those brave-hearts I will conduct "mock experiments" to help you take that first step towards the poly lifestyle. These will be staged experiences in a safe environment just to help you learn to open up the communication about what you want. Hopefully you will be brave enough to come out to your significant other or you will learn to find the right people to support your goals to have a polyamorous lifestyle. Why live a secret life when you can jump into a world of people that would embrace you? If nothing else, you owe yourself honesty, acceptance & love!
results.name: Women's Polyamory Project

With a global network of smart, talented women and a market reach exceeding 2 million, WITI has established powerful strategic alliances and programs to provide connections, resources, and opportunities within a supportive environment of women committed to helping each other.

results.description:
La Fama is a Social Dance Party event that takes place every Friday night in a cozy boutique studio in Times Square, from 9:30pm until 3am

The purpose of this meetup group is to provide a place for people to learn how to dance Salsa in a friendly, patient, and convenient environment. For that, we have chosen to host this event in a Studio located in Times Square, where transportation is not an issue . We have chosen Friday so that you can spend the night with no worries about getting up early for work.

We have chosen to make the event affordable with no extra expenses. We have chosen to give a Free class starting at 9:30pm till 10:30pm for those who would like to learn this dance. We also have a DJ that plays music (90% Salsa, 5% Bachata, 5% Cha Cha) you can feel and enjoy. There are no lines to get in. This event is about learning, dancing, and meeting new people (All levels of dancing or enjoyment of Salsa Music are welcome). So come out and have a blast.  See you there!

results.description:
As a brand new unconventional Relationship Coach hitting the NYC scene, I have decided to create a group to share the wisdom I have gained throughout 11 years of marital drama.  I will explore radical ideas and will most likely shock and awe you with my personal experiences.   It's all in good fun however, and designed to transform your life & your mind.  With my lighthearted & humorous approach you're sure to have a great time!


Do you want to transcend fear in your relationship? Would you love to beat jealousy? Do you wish you understood your partner better or just want a stronger bond? Are you single and afraid to love because you have been hurt too many times or you can't find someone that meets your standards? 


If so, this is the group for you! This meetup is a movement that will consist of community forums, a talk show (which will be aired online) & an original reality show project that has NEVER been done before!   We will be meeting weekly to watch a variety of TV shows, documentaries & video testimonials covering many relationship topics ranging from infidelity, polyamory, monogamy, marriage, divorce, cohabitation, successful dating, living apart together (LAT) & much more.  After the screening, we will discuss what we have just watched while I share my unconventional relationship experiences with the group. My lighthearted & humorous approach will fun & delightful experience!


You may also sign up for a variety of break out programs that will be a part of the overall movement.  To cover our rental location, refreshments & guest bookings, group forums will cost between $10 - $30. Our special after work discounted screening & discussion sessions will cost only $7!
results.name: Hard Truth Real Love!

results.description:
This group is for anyone who is interested in discussing or learning about WordPress as a user, developer or designer. WordPress is the Internet's most popular and fastest growing content management system for business and blogging websites .

This group is a monthly gathering to discuss how to best leverage your website to get your message out into the interweb. Each month there will be a topic discussion as well as time to get your questions answered on websites, marketing, SEO, Web Design, Social Media and related topics and technologies.

Our goal is to foster a supportive environment where that meets the needs of the members.  


Whether you are a user, designer, developer, webmaster or just have questions about WordPress usage, designing WordPress Themes and styles or creating WordPress Plugins and Widgets this will be a great resource for you.

The internet is changing rapidly which makes it difficult to know "what's working now". The presentations will be focusing on real scenarios and battle tested solutions.

This Meetup is:

• A great place to meet other people like you who are interested in using WordPress achieve their organizational or personal goals.

• For the benefit of the WordPress community and others interested in learning more about WordPress with a focus on the best interest of the members.

• Volunteer-run with volunteer speakers and we encourage your participation.

• A welcoming place where we are committed to fostering an accepting environment.

• A great place to share your knowledge and experience with other members

• For businesses, entrepreneurs, writers, bloggers, marketers, students and others looking to communicate through a website.


Come join us to learn and share!
results.name: WordPress North Jersey Meetup

results.description:
Metro Real Estate Investors Association

“Dedicated to the art of real estate investing and helping our members achieve success”

Real Estate is the greatest wealth builder in the United States, particularly for most people starting out with little cash to invest.

Are you serious about getting a solid real estate education and how to make long-term steady profits in real estate?

Then consider the Metro Real Estate Investors Association. (MREIA)

We are the oldest real estate investing association in New Jersey, originally founded in 1982! MREIA is a volunteer-run association whose officers dedicate their time and effort to helping members achieve their investing goals.

Networking (sharing information, investing tips, etc.) is the heart and soul of a successful Real Estate Investing Association and MREIA has members who have with us 25-30 years.

No matter what level you are at from beginner to experienced, whether you have yet to buy your first investment property or own dozens of properties,… MREIA is for you!

Please do not get ripped off by spending anywhere from $5,000 to $25,000 for so called ”real estate education and mentoring.. Our annual membership is $150 and all day weekend classes and workshops are $29 - $99.

Our monthly meetings (3rd Monday of the month) are chock full of solid real estate investing education from full time investors and specialists in their fields  (not full time “gurus” hawking the newest “get rich quick” scheme”).

Below are just some of the topics explored at our meetings:

*Creating Positive Cash Flow!

  *Wholesaling!

  *Foreclosures!

  *Options!

  *Rehabbing for Fun and Profit!

   *Finding and Structuring Deals!

  *Selling for Maximum Profit!

  *REO Properties and Short Sales!

  *Negotiating Strategies!

  *Using Private Financing!

Please visit our website at  www.mreia.com. to find out how membership in MREIA can help you realize your dream of financial independence through real estate investing

Members receive our monthly e- newsletter “The Metro.” Each issue contains 25-28 articles on important real estate topics, info on upcoming meetings, and things you need to know such as upcoming legislation that will impact the world of real estate investing.

If you are serious about your real estate investing career joining MREIA is an absolute bargain at only $150.00 per year.

Please visit our website at  www.mreia.com. to find out how membership in MREIA can help you realize your dream of financial independence through real estate investing

Please Call Dan (MREIA President) at 201-791-4639 if you have any questions after visiting www.mreia.com

We hope to see you at our next meeting!
results.name: Metro Real Estate Investors Association

Welcome to investFeed Social Network NYC Traders & Investors!

We are a community of passionate finance professionals, executives, and entrepreneurs with a common desire to meet like-minded people, learn from each other, and share ideas about the financial markets. If you are a veteran or aspiring trader, market analyst, portfolio manager, or private investor, you’ve come to the right place.

We host regular networking and special events (and awesome parties!) in the greater NY, NJ, and Pennsylvania area: if you’re interested in investing and want to network with finance professionals at the top of their game, you want to come to our events!

investFeed is the fastest-growing financial social network and was created to empower all investors with their trades decisions. We let you see where top-performing investors really put their money and let you earn real money to share your investment strategies with other investors.

Most of us are members of investFeed (it’s free to join), but it’s not a requirement. Come meet us at our next networking event and see what we’re about!

Who should Join:   Smart, savvy, ambitious women to improve their communication skills and voice in todays in the workplace in order to bring their careers to the next level.   We think getting ambitious women in a room together talking, and learning new skills we can build a community to  create positive change in the paradigm of what "works" in communication.    This is an 18+ event. 

  Vital Voice Jam Sessions are quick and dirty hour long sessions to work on specific skill sets dealing with communication, networking, and getting your voice heard. Our workshops aim to be as fun as they are informative.   

Jam Sessions have come out of a desire to start to tackle some of the more specific concerns our clients come to us with:  How to give an elevator pitch, Networking for Introverts, Negotiation, Interview Skills, Dealing with interruptions, Pitching Important Ideas.  While these are big issues that will certainly not be fully resolved in an hour, we can get you started in thinking about them in a different way- and give you a few tools to add to your tool bag.    

1st Session will be Art of the Elevator Pitch (Nov. 18th, 6:30-7:30 pm. Location: Manhattan). Learn to articulate your value and values with ease, savvy, and style. Our attention spans are shorter. Our lives are busier. And our mental hard drives are at capacity. So when you only have 30 seconds to make an impact, you need to be sure of both what to say and how to say it. The “elevator pitch” can feel outdated, phony, and utterly cringe-inducing . . . but it doesn't have to be. A well crafted elevator pitch can bring out your inner rock star, give people a sense of what you're about (beyond what you "do" -and begin genuine connections. New York-based voice and speech coaches Casey Erin Clark and Julie Fogh of Vital Voice Training will give you the principles to construct and refine a compelling elevator pitch AND show you how to deliver it in a way that truly lands and connects with your audience. Workshop participants will be able to get on your feet, practice, and start to make some connections with other professionals. Post packet PDF included. Cost: $35
results.name: Vital Voice Jam Sessions:  The Art of the Elevator Pitch

results.description:
This meetup has been formed to discuss customer use cases and design patterns related to Apache Apex, a next generation native Hadoop big data platform. Apex unifies stream and batch processing. Use cases include ingestion, fast real-time analytics, data movement, disastor recovery in Hadoop, ETL, fast batch, alerts and real-time actions. Apex is a Hadoop-native YARN implementation. It simplifies development and productization of Hadoop applications by reducing time to market. Key features include Enterprise Grade Operability with Fault Tolerance, State Management, Event Processing Guarantees, No Data Loss, High Performance, Linear Scalability. Additionally Apache Apex includes Apache Malhar library of over 400 reusable operators (functions). These include connectors to external systems like message bus, file systems, databases, etc.  Apache Apex enables users to run any user defined code natively in Hadoop.

Please join the community on Apache Apex Forum (send an email to dev-subscribe@apex.incubator.apache.org).
results.name: Apache Apex (native Hadoop), New York Chapter

This group will focus on distilling the essential teachings of the major traditions, East and West, in an effective and interesting synthesis applicable to the postmodern world. If you despise the anything-goes approach of the New Age movement, the overly logical methods of philosophers, and the rather secular style of meditation, yet strongly desire to know what worlds beyond this one contain, this group may help you in your quest.

The topics we'll cover will be eclectic and assorted, and will include, among others: the myth and symbolism of ancient Egypt, the Kaballah, shamanic journeying, awakening Kundalini, death and rebirth, modern occultism and the left-hand path, creating rituals, understanding one's true purpose, energy healing, invoking spirits and using mundras. 

Whenever possible, I'll focus on application and direct experience of what I discuss through the use of art, rituals and specific practices.

This group will be best suited to those with several years of magical/spiritual study or those who've been initiated into at least one tradition. 

If you would like to co-teach any of these topics, please message me.

results.description:
This group is all about building a positive relationship and bond with your dog through science based training and benevolent leadership with fun activities and events. We host monthly meetings so that you can work on your dog's loose leash walking, socialization, and/or reactivity challenges in a relaxed environment and with guidance from the organizer or other members of meetup group. We are here to have fun and make every experience with our dogs a mutually enjoyable one for both handler and dog. We are offering some basic obedience classes as well. The bulk of the classes are related to helping your dog attain the skills necessary to achieve Canine Good Citizen, an AKC-recognized title. The skills of CGC should be something every dog owner strives for. We offer all CGC classes as small classes so that you get personal attention and help during each class. We offer free training classes for foster dogs of rescue groups and shelters as we strive to be a community training resource for the homeless animals. We ask as a member that you promise to: 

1. Be loyal to the absent and treat one another with kindness. We have no patience for drama or pettiness. 

2. Breed discrimination is not tolerated. We love all dogs, big and small. 

3. Class sizes are limited! If you RSVP, please honor it. 

4. Always bring: Water, potty bags, high-value treats or toy items, and always bring a good attitude 

5. Respect of other dog/handler teams is a must. Your dog should only meet other dogs when invited to do so by its handler. Please ask before you assume! 

6. No retractable leashes. 

7. One dog per handler for most events. If you would like special consideration, please email the organizer. 

8. Please keep dogs that are in training in collars or harnesses they cannot escape from. The absolute worst thing would be to lose a dog at an event. Please be patient as this group develops and grows.


If you have any questions, concerns, or suggestions, please let me know. 

This meet up is open for all dog lovers (you don't have to have a dog), owners, adopters, rescuers, volunteers, who are seeking the balanced relationship between dogs and human, raising the awareness of the importance of dog training and responsible dog ownership.  

The meet up events include but not limited to: Dog Obedience Training; Dog Agility Training; Dog Rehabilitation; Off-leash adventures; Skijoring; BikeJoring; etc 

Locations of the meetups -Staten Island South Beach Area. When joining this Meetup group, please post a picture of your dog as your profile picture. 

Meet Up group are safe, therefore, everyone must keep their dogs up to date with all vaccinations and only join the pack if there is no history of uncontrollable aggressive behavior. By joining the group, you agree to release the groups organizer and members from any and all liability with regard to group activities. You are responsible for your dog at all events and agree to keep your dog under control.
results.name: Staten Island Active Dogs Meet-up

results.description:
We meet each Saturday (11:30am) at the East Rutherford Memorial Library (143 Boiling Springs Ave, East Rutherford, NJ 07073) to meditate and experience the innate connection we have with each other and the energy that created us.

All across the globe, everyone is seeking new sources of energy. Meanwhile, the most transformative energy of all is hiding in plain sight. It's natural, sustainable, and infinitely renewable. It's called Inner Energy. And everyone already has it — including you. Become balanced and better connected to yourself — emotionally, physically, and spiritually. If you're having trouble juggling the challenges in your life, Sahaja Yoga Meditation can help you manage stress, master your emotions and find solutions to your problems. You'll enjoy better health, better focus, and a deeper understanding of the universe and your place in it. Sahaja Yoga Meditation is much more than feeling peaceful and relaxed. Within each of us are layers, varied and deep. Explore at your own pace, in your own way. And our experts are always available to help. Ready to plug into your inner energy? A few minutes of Sahaja Yoga Meditation every day may be all it takes to connect to your inner energy (called kundalini in the yogic tradition) and light the path to lifelong transformation. Sahaja is more than a temporary solution or quick relief; it's a journey to complete fulfillment. All classes are free. Everyone is welcome. Bring a friend, bring your kids — we welcome all ages. 

Unlike other forms of meditation or yoga, this is not something you "do" - it is more about a state of becoming, of "being" rather than doing, a living process that transforms your life from within.

For more, visit www.sahajameditation.com. Sahaja Yoga Meditation is a not-for-profit offering free spiritual meditation guidance in more than 100 countries worldwide.
results.name: East Rutherford Sahaja Yoga Meditation

We look forward to you attending our workshops.   Andrea Rose has a  private consulting business for inventors. If you would like to  schedule a private  one-on-one consultation email her at:  andrea@andrearoseinventions.com

results.description:
ARTEMIS is a social/activity group for adult women of any age (18 and older*) living in the New York City area (or greater metro area) who have either been formally or self-diagnosed with some form of autism -- whether aspergers, autism or related diagnoses. The group is organized by a woman with self-diagnosed aspergers in her early 30s (not a mental health professional) and is not affiliated with any organizations.

Connect with other women with similar backgrounds and communication styles through get-togethers, creative expression workshops, visits to museums and other cool places around the city, and whatever other activities that the group would be interested in doing -- I would love to have people suggest things they'd like to do in the future and help to plan events or happenings if they are interested in doing so.

ARTEMIS aims to be a non-judgemental, drama-free zone where women can feel safe just being themselves and relax with other ladies who "get it" with the eventual goal of building a small group of friends. I will aim to plan a meet-up once a month and the meetups will be mostly in manhattan and occasionally in one of the boroughs if we decide to go somewhere there.

This group is an LGBTQ safe space, meaning, among other things, trans women and genderqueer individuals who identify with the female experience are entirely welcome. If this makes you uncomfortable, please do not join.

Please read the group ground rules before joining by clicking on "Pages" and looking at the "Group Ground Rules" page before joining the group.

**This Just In: I've started a Secret Facebook group for ARTEMIS (a private group that won't show up in a search, only members can see who's in it, and has no direct link), so that we can get to know each other a bit more and have another platform for sharing resources and ideas for future meetups! If you would like to join that group, please join this group first and then send me a message asking to join the Facebook group and I will make it happen.**

Read and learn more about autism in women by clicking on "Pages" and looking at the Resources page.

*if you are younger than 18, you can also join the group but please message me first.
results.name: ARTEMIS - Community for Women of the Autism Spectrum in NYC

results.description:
We're a tightly knit group of motivated study buddies who are targeting 700+ scores and top 10 B-schools and who are already reasonably familiar with GMAT structure and content. 

The group philosophy is that small study groups whose members have similar goals and skill-levels are effective and efficient, allowing for fast-paced, targeted learning.

A bit of background about me: I graduated from Cornell University in 2014 and finished a top-rated test preparation program. I have scheduled my first (and hopefully last) exam for March 2016.

We meet around Midtown (coffee shops near GCT or the Cornell Club) at nights on weekdays and weekends. 

If you're interested in joining, you can contact me at gtm33@cornell.edu or message me through this site.

All the best,

Greg
results.name: GMAsTers - NY GMAT Study Group for Aspiring 99 Percenters

results.description:
Ready to fall in love? 

To have the crazy, sexy, passionate relationship you’ve always fantasized about? 

You’ve joined the right group.

Since you’re here, I can only figure that putting yourself out there isn’t the challenge.

Do you keep attracting the same relationship, only with a different person?

Or maybe you go on a lot of lackluster dates?

Or have trouble getting past date number one?

I get it. Trust me, I’ve been there. This group exists to shift that paradigm, and to have fun while doing it!

So what are we going to do together?

We’re going to connect.

We’re going to travel.

We’re going to grow.

We’re going to get uncomfortable.

We’re going to stretch ourselves and be comforted that everyone else is also out of their comfort zones.

Most importantly we’re going to have fun and meet interesting people, who’s intentions are a little deeper than finding their next date.

Thank you so much for being willing to allow me in on your journey, and I can’t wait to meet you!

~ Danita
results.name: Relationship Ready Singles - New York

results.description:
I am a Life Strategy Coach, I assist people in a multitude of ways. I formed this is a group for people who are looking for ways to balance business life.  In todays environment where people are juggling multiple businesses,  members are given opportunities to learn effective ways to  delegate  and manage work loads. Workshops are also provided to help with goal achieving.

Members will benefit from monthly and sometime weekly workshops that will teach you how to distress, work through business and personal challenges, and make the most of your business and leisure time. workshops will also help people to maximize their potential. you will work on goal attainment, and how to live more purposefully. I assist those who choose to make changes into entrepreneurship, and those who are making life changes from working to retirement, changing positions, and re-entering the work world.

Many activities are in the works for the members of this group. No matter what industry your from, you can join. The idea is to become the best you can be at home and at work, and hopefully we can enjoy a little fun in between!

Business Group Description:

This group is for people who would like to learn how to improve their leadership skills, understand the role of manager/ entrepreneur, social media, the importance of purposeful networking, public speaking, creating a positive image, balancing multiple projects, and balancing the roles of entrepreneur and employee.

Since I am a Life Strategy Coach, I work with people who juggle the roles of entrepreneur and employee, as well as those who desire to work their way up the management ladder. 

This group is productive for people who are re-entering the work world, and those who are considering retiring but are still active and would like to consider retirement as another phase of their life plan.

Workshops planned will include:

Managing Stress in the workplace

Public Speaking

Dressing for Success

Purposeful Networking

Perfecting Elevator Speech

Creating your 5 year plan

Working with Social Media

Balancing work/business/home

Also:

Monthly social activities to Meetup with members and introduce potential new members.

topics.name: Improve your Life, Looks and Finances

results.description:
This NYC Make Peace with Cash Flows Meetup group might be ideal for you if you are interested in developing peace with your current personal cash flows and professional networking.  Even if you are in a good place with your current situation, here is a good opportunity to optimize for the future while also helping others. This group was formed as my life was growing in different areas, and it took time for me to be at peace while being on the same page with my loved ones. Once I found that peace and meaning in my life, I felt the need to pay it forward.  It is great to know where you want to go by having goals and while savings and investments are certainly important, they are not everything.  Now let’s take it a step further and gain some peace of mind by getting totally clear about our current personal cash flows.  Let's do this without having destination disease - curious about what that is? Show up and learn how to move past that phase.

Let's be present in the movement and transparent about our future actions.  Let’s be proactive, be the catalyst to change and always be prepared to react to the new unforseen events that affect our lives.  Let's build with like-minded people that are thinking clear and concisely about their current cash flows.


We will then continue by disecting some case studies of life situations that might cause one to lose that said peace of mind and then best practices on how to move forward with a safe and sound mindset.  While we go through our presentation, we will discuss hidden current costs that can effect your current monetary situations.  We will also be sharing solutions to create a sanctuary in ourselves by getting clear on our cash flow realities. We suggest you share issues and solutions throughout the process. We always make sure to leave at least 15 to 30mins for networking encouragement and questions.
results.name: NYC Peace with Cash flows Meetup

results.description:
Who we are: Brooklyn Wallyball club has called Eastern Athletic Club (EAC) it's home since 1981.  In that time it has become the undisputed all time winningest Wallyball program anywhere in the country  with more than 70 National titles at all levels in all divisions. 

If you are either an Open or Advanced level Volleyball/Wallyball  player we encourage you to join this meetup and come join us for a great and competitive Wallyball game. 

Location: Eastern Athletic Club (EAC)  43 Clark St. Brooklyn,N.Y.   Closest Subway is the Clark Street station on the 2/3 line

Time:  Every SUNDAY 3pm -7pm

We will assess your basic Volleyball skills when you first join to determine the most appropriate division for you to play in.  We reserve the right to deny anyone membership that does not possess the minimum basic skills required in order to ensure the safety and enjoyment of all members. 

Divisions:  Men's, Women and Co-ed Triples and doubles at the advanced and open levels

Membership: Membership is for the entire season only, which runs from November 1st 2015 through May 1st, 2016.   Membership fee is $220 which covers access to EAC and the court fees during the allotted Wallyball time.   This membership fee is NOT prorated  so the best value is to come as early in the season as possible.

To encourge you to check the game out before you sign up, notify our leadership team about what day you wish to come and special arrangements with the facility will be made to provide a ONE-TIME ONLY complimentary admission  to play.  


Videos:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=73g_9a9tieg...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=36-sJ5JISwA
results.name: Brooklyn Wallyball Club

I also conduct classes in:

Using reiki in your everyday life

Finding your true purpose

How to turn reiki into a business opportunity

Together we will discuss, share, and empower one another while learning how to use our thoughts to create a better living environment. We will enjoy activities that increase your awareness in reiki energy, as I teach you how to incorporate reiki into your daily lives.

Also planned are networking opportunities that are designed to broaden your health base community and support your efforts for good health and well- being. 

You will learn that reiki is not just for a healthy body, but will strengthen and enhance healthy thinking. Using reiki positively influences the building of healthy relationships, and helps with the removal of negative thinking while promoting positive behaviors.

Those of you who would like to learn reiki will benefit by becoming a member, since you will be able to take advantage of these workshops and sessions. You will also receive a certificate after completing your desired level. (which is included in your monthly membership fee!) 

So come and join in, to learn and experience, and explore the benefits of alternate healing and living. Everyone has a journey. Those of you who are looking within and around for the answers of where is your life taking you, will find that being a member will be fun as well as  enlightening.

This Organization's soul purpose is to help and inspire creatives PAVE THEIR OWN WAY. Each and every event and meetup will be one of value to help uplift independent creatives. There will be motivational speakers, thought leaders, trainings, networking events and many other helpful resources to come! The bigger we make this the more we can do for each other!

(My name is Maribel aka Bella, a creative of many lanes born and raised in New York. As a creative but first and foremost a person I've been disillusioned and overwhelmed by disappointments, distractions, con artist, financial hardships, non-believers, and false inadequacies forced upon me. I’m sure that sounds and feels familiar to a lot of you... So let me tell you what I’ve learned: That you don’t need anyone’s approval to be great, that you belong wherever you go and want to be, that sharing knowledge and helping others will always benefit you and that you don’t need an ivy league education, all you need is your talent, drive, and ideally some support. (We do our selves and others an injustice in holding back. Join me in not doing that anymore)

results.description:
The mission of the Israeli-American Council (IAC) is to build an engaged and united Israeli-American community that strengthens our next generations, the American Jewish community and the State of Israel.

Over half a million Israeli-Americans live in the United States today. As a vital component of American society, they play a major role in social activism, academia, culture and innovation. The Israeli-American Council (IAC) is the largest Israeli-American organization in the United States, serving this vibrant sector of American society. The IAC’s effectiveness and success is the direct result of its ability to organize, activate, and engage the Israeli-American community nationwide. The IAC strives to achieve these goals through programs and events for all ages, as well as by empowering and sponsoring a wide array of non-profit organizations within the Israeli-American community.

This is a group for all the Israeli American's out there in New Jersey. Where we can share meetings and initiatives, ideas and events.
results.name: Israeli American Council (IAC) in New Jersey

results.description: Ski Season is almost here! Let's go skiing. This group is for the skier who doesnt want to go far - just a day trip to Windham/Hunter and it's cool! Tired of getting up at 4:30am to catch a bus for an overpriced day trip to Windham or Hunter? Problem solved! Let's carpool from the Westchester/Rockland/Lower Fairfield area for a casual day trip to Windham or Hunter. Let's leave at 9am and get a half-day ticket. Or ski a full day and still leave at 8am! Both ski areas are just over 2 hrs from the Westchester area and provide enough variety on the slope or off the slopes. No need to rush home after a day of skiing.......let's listen to some music in the lodge and relax before heading out. The goal of this group is to have meetups at local Westchester bars so we can meet other ski buddies and arrange carpools so we can all ski together. And also to have a drink or 2! If you're into hanging out at the lodge, thats cool too....no need to be a skier. For those with weekend houses in the Windham/Hunter area, this is a great way to meet other skiers to ski with from the Westchester area.

We offer rides at all levels, from the beginner’s level to the advance + level 

We will have bike tours every now and then on a weekend during the season 

We will also post after work rides: (we called it ride and eat rides) in the summer.   

The group will have a beginning of the season get together and an end of the season get together.

We, each, individually challenge ourselves to keep a competitive pace, recognizing a diversity of limits, and still take time to stop and smell the roses. Most all events allow for time to socialize, and grab a bite to eat, and encourage the bond that comes with riding together.

We are not a professional organization, just a group of like minded individuals who share an interest in cycling.  When you RSVP YES for an event, you agree to be responsible for your own safety and your guest, on your own equipment, and hold no one else liable for any accident, injury or event.

For great inspiration and a taste of how much  we love cycling and want you to love it too, see this amazing introduction by Tom: http://www.meetup.com/Westchester-Social-Cycling/messages/boards/thread/26306702

results.description:
Hey Basketball Boot Campers, 

I'm Coach Trevor Huffman, the director of King Hoops NYC and part of our new concept that is one part Soul Cycle, one part fitness Boot Camp, and lastly, one part WNBA training camp for female (only) athletes that want to get off the treadmill, elliptical, or row machine and get into amazing shape working out with a group of ladies that all want to grow as people, basketball players, and mostly, athletes. 

 With over 20 years combined experience working in specialized sports performance academies, playing and training in the NBA and top European leagues (for 12 years), our King Hoops NYC's staff look forward to getting you back to Prime Time fitness status. 

Get pumped with our inspiring music, and burn more calories than you can dream of by executing fast paced basketball drills, competing in shooting and dribbling skill development drills, and jumping into full body workouts with medicine balls, bands, and plyometrics!

King Hoops NYC's goal is to get you back into shape (or in game shape) and have as much fun as possible while we do it!

I look forward to meeting and starting the rewarding journey of growth in your personal and athletic lives!

Best, 

 Coach T

PS. If you are an intermediate to advanced player and want to join CO-ED Adult Basketball Bootcamp and meet some great people, join here: http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Adult-Basketball-Boot-Camp/
results.name: Women's Fitness Basketball Boot Camp

results.description:
Does TensorFlow have the potential to become the engine behind most successful consumer and industrial products of the next 10-20 years? 

Absolutely! A much better question is how, and in what new ways, can we:

a) train more computers to teach themselves by sifting through massive amounts of data coming out of all sorts of places

b) make these computers available through an API to provide a high-quality answer to anyone who is in need. 

Why? Because everyone in need deserves the right answer. 

So.... why don't we standardize & democratize the field with and around TensorFlow, and help change the world!?

What. We are a local micro community of those interested in advancing their knowledge of TensorFlow, its use cases and applications.

How. Join our group for a regular dose of human interaction, conversations, smiles, food and drinks on all things TensorFlow:

• How-To's & Best Practices

• Tutorials

• Models

• Algorithms

• Multi-GPU Autoscaling in the cloud

• Tools & Integrations

We will learn how others solve some of the hard problems that exist in the world around us, and how others make predictive APIs and applications.

Join the movement. Let’s change the world. Because everyone in need deserves the right answer.

You are welcome:)
results.name: TensorFlow New York City

results.description: The aim of this meetup is to foster competitive scrabble play in a meetup setting. This encompasses scrabble play with clocks, challenges and no looking in the dictionary before you play a word. I have enough equipment for four players or two games. The idea of this meetup is an alternative from playing scrabble online. When people play online there is no supervision so you don't know if the game is legitimate or not. The rules: 25:00 in a standard scrabble game for each opponent. If you go over your clock a minute you are penalized ten points even if it is one second. This event will be held at the Greenhouse Cafe at 7717 3rd Ave Brooklyn NY 11209 7-10:30 pm alternate Tuesdays. Directions are the R train to 77th street and walk one block south to third avenue. The B37 also stop right in front of the establishment. My name is Kris I hope to see you there.

results.description:
This is a group for anyone in their 20's, 30's or 40's who supports the mission of Project Music (see below). The group will provide an opportunity to meet like-minded people, socialize and network - all while contributing to a fantastic cause. We will have happy hours, live music events, fundraising drives, and chances to witness the amazing positive influence the program has on its students. 

Project Music is a free intensive after-school music education program for students in Stamford, Connecticut. The program is inspired by Venezuela’s “music education miracle” known as El Sistema, a program for social change created over 30 years ago. PROJECT MUSIC provides music education, instruments, and mentorship to Stamford youngsters. PROJECT MUSIC is intended not only to provide musical instruments and training, but also to address some of the extensive social challenges affecting Stamford’s youth. To this end, we use music to cultivate fundamental life skills such as self-expression, cooperative learning, discipline, leadership, and creativity— all of which have been linked to improved social and academic outcomes. The program fills a gap in accessible quality music education and after­-school care in the City of Stamford.
results.name: Project Music - Young Leadership Committee - Stamford

results.description:
We want to build a community for current and prospective Udacity students of all Nanodegree programs to gather together and advance their education. 

Our mission is to bring accessible, affordable, engaging, and highly effective higher education to the world. We believe that higher education is a basic human right, and we seek to empower our students to advance their education and careers. Education is no longer a one-time event but a lifelong experience. Education should be less passive listening (no long lectures) and more active doing. Education should empower students to succeed not just in school but in life.

We gather a few times a month to work through course content as well as host interesting events such as speaker series and hack-a-thons that take learning beyond the virtual classroom. Can't wait to see you soon!

The Udacity NYC Meetup is a flat organization, meaning we are not a "top-down" hierarchy. Members should feel free to suggest Meetup topics and events. Members who consistently demonstrate their dedication to the group may be given some moderator powers, which include the ability to create and host events.

"Dude, remember the golden rule - be excellent to each other.' Bill & Ted
results.name: Udacity NYC Meetup

results.description: Veteran's Helping Hands (vetohh) was formed in August 2015 by a Veteran facing a challenging transition. With the support of family and friends, she created Veteran's Helping Hands to reach out to other Veterans who are in the same situation as her. Vetohh serves as a support system for Veterans starting over in a new city. Vetohh organized the #thankourVets grassroot open source movement dedicated to raise Veteran transition awareness, promote Veteran benefits reform and support research on Veteran re-integration. Through a network of public-private partnerships, Veteran Organizations and concerned citizens, vetohh hopes to make a difference in a Veteran's life, one Vet at time.
results.name: Veteran's Helping Hands (Vetohh)

results.description: This group is for women who are entrepreneurs or aspiring entrepreneurs in the fields of yoga, fitness, wellness, and holistic health. I started this group to help women entrepreneurs be supported by one another, to connect, learn, grow and be in a community that builds confidence to help you step into your power and claim your self-worth so that you can do the work that you love and be of service to others AND be able to financially support yourself and your lifestyle of choice without sacrificing your own wellbeing in the process. Whether you are a long time business owner or just starting out, working for yourself, can be a very lonely and sometimes a little scary. We don't always know all the right things to do and we are often afraid, ashamed or too stubborn to ask for help. By nature, we are passionate, giving, independent and creative. A community of like-minded women going for it in their lives and businesses is a force to be reckoned with. Upon my return to the US, I was excited to seek out venues where I could share my experience and continue tasting and learning about teas with others in the gay community. This proved to be a difficult, if not impossible, task! I have formed this meetup social to bring together gay men from the area who share my passion. We will mostly taste and discuss green, white, oolong, black and puer teas from China, Taiwan, Japan and India. Our group will visit tea houses, tea events and perhaps once we get to know each other have tea sociasl at each others homes. Members' suggestions and participation is encouraged in order to keep it interesting. Although we would like to keep a non-strict, casual environment, RSVP is necessary in order to prepare accordingly. Three no-shows will result in your exclusion from the group. results.description:
We are a community of people for whom just drinking wine is not enough. We have all levels of experience and while not in the industry, always look for opportunities to learn about wine. 

One Friday a month, we hire a wine educator to pick out wines and take us through a tasting based on a topic of our choosing. Generally, we do one round of tasting without food and then we go back to our favorites while socializing over snacks. The idea of this gathering is to learn the basics of tasting while going through different wine regions and styles throughout the world. 

Occasionally we have field trips to different wine bars or wine centric places in NYC (Manhattan or Brooklyn) to do tastings there. These are less formal than our monthly tastings and let us learn about the different people, places, and perspectives through NYC.

In terms of cost, Wine Club members split the cost of all events. Non-restaurant events are usually hosted in one of our apartments - typically in Brooklyn by the Barclays Center but any member can offer to host.
results.name: NYC Wine Club Meetup

This group is for Photographers that are serious about wanting to learn & practice fine art photography while building their portfolio.  Photographers that respect the models. 

We will host group shoots with experienced models, with professional studio lighting. We will shoot in studios, locations, hotel rooms anywhere with an interesting backdrop.  Events will happen 1-2 times a week.   Each photographer will take turns using the strobes, positioning the lights and the models.  The other photographers can use the continuous light during others turn We will also host some photoshop, and lighting classes

results.description:
Superbrain Yoga® is a simple and effective technique to energize and recharge the brain. It is based on the principles of subtle energy and ear acupuncture. This powerful technique is explained in Master Choa Kok Sui's latest book Superbrain Yoga®. 
A US news story Superbrain Yoga can now be viewed on You Tube click here

Pilot studies on the effects of Superbrain Yoga® on school children include children with disabilities such as ADHD/ADD, developmental and cognitive delays, Down syndrome and specific learning disabilities. Children studied showed significant increase in academic and behavioral performance, greater class participation and improved social skills. In one study, the result of an electroencephalograph showed increased amplitude in the parieto-occipital region of the brain following the Superbrain Yoga®. This indicates increased brain electrical activity following the exercise. More studies on the effects of Superbrain Yoga®are being conducted.
results.name: MCKS Super Brain Yoga

results.description:
This group is for digital product designers who are interested in exploring the experience between physical and digital space. How can we bring the same design thinking we do for digital products into the physical space? How can we make the everyday apps we already use more interesting with in-real-life touch points? How might we create in-real-life buttons that create digital trails? This is a group for product designers, experimenters and people interested in the intersection between physical and digital things to come together and prototype ideas quickly. We'll host workshops around design challenges so you can make time for experimentation and play outside of work. Design challenges we might try:

• Create something that fixes an annoying problem you face every day.
• Create something that makes your favorite app come to life.
• Create something that makes people laugh
• Create something to help strangers start talking to each other.
• Create something that replaces the last thing you threw away yesterday.

We’ll use kits from LittleBits™— inputs like the Button, Motion Trigger and slide dimmer, connect with the CloudBit and IFTTT to make your offline buttons come to life. 

What is LittleBits™?

littleBits is a platform of easy-to-use electronic building blocks that empower you to invent anything, from your own remote controlled car, to a smart home device. The Bits snap together with magnets, no soldering, no wiring, no programming needed.

Meetups will be held at the LittleBits™ pop-up store in SoHo.
results.name: NYC Makers Meetup

results.description:
Do you look at the mirror often and obsess about a flaw? Do you think when you go out everyone is shunning you because of a specific "flaw?"Does your low self-esteem hinder you from engaging in normal social activities? Do you feel stressed at the notion of having to mingle at a birthday or holiday party?  I suffer from these types of insecurities, stresses, and obsessions and wanted to start a group where people who have BDD (Body Dysmorphic Disorder) and Social Anxiety Disorder (SAD) could get support by talking things through. I have been diagnosed with BDD and have isolated myself from many facets of life for the last few years. I have a dread that someone in public will comment on my flaws. 

I am starting this group with no lofty ambition other then to connect those who feel that they have become imprisoned by low self-esteem, social anxiety, and distorted body/face image. Perhaps through sharing our stories we can heal and feel less alone.  If you would like to come to a meetup please tell me a little about yourself. I am also starting this meetup because there is no other BDD support group I could find locally.
results.name: West Orange Body Dysmorphic & Social Anxiety Disorder Meetup

results.description:
This is a group for people who would like to get up early on Sunday mornings to talk about great books over some coffee or tea with like-minded fellow New Yorkers. 

When and where to meet? 

-- Meeting twice a month, at a cafe or restaurant in Manhattan, on Sunday mornings. The core discussion time is from 8:30 - 9:30 am. The social time, which is optional, is 30 minutes before and after the discussion time. (I.E., 8:00 - 8:30 am and 9:30 -10:00 am). You can use the social time to eat breakfast, brunch or to just chat. 

How the books are chosen? 

-- Anyone who volunteers to be a facilitator of a meeting has the right to choose the book to discuss for that meeting and the exact location to meet. 

As suggestions,  we can choose the books from the following book lists: 

1. All-Time 100 Novels (chosen by Time Magazine) http://entertainment.time.com/2005/10/16/all-time-100-nov... 

2. Winners of Pulitzer Prize in Biography or Autobiography Category http://www.pulitzer.org/bycat/Biography-or-Autobiography 

3. Oprah's Book Club list http://static.oprah.com/pdf/obc-complete-list.pdf 

4. Other bestseller lists, such as New York Times Best Sellers, Wall Street Journal Best Selling Books 

5. Classics

Any Fees in becoming a member and attending a meeting?

There are no fees to become a member of this Meetup group.
results.name: Early Risers' Book Club

results.description:
Welcome to the meetup page for New York City chapter of National Women's Liberation. National Women's Liberation (NWL) is a new feminist group with old roots. The organization was born from a collaboration between organizers from Redstockings and Gainesville Women's Liberation (FL) which started in 1968. We are a dynamic and diverse group of women in the fight against male supremacy, developing theory alongside our actions. An integral part of our organization is the Women of Color Caucus (WOCC) which meets separately from white women to better understand how white supremacy intersects with other forms of oppression. Our group hosts public meetings the third Tuesday of every month at The Commons at 388 Atlantic Ave, and all women are welcome.

NWL won a big victory in 2013 when the Morning-After Pill was put over the counter for all ages, the fruits of a 10-year battle that included a sit-in at the FDA, illegally giving out the pill to show the ridiculousness of the restrictions, and a class action lawsuit. Current priorities are the right to abortion and birth control and the overthrow of the double day--women's roles as full-time caretakers and full time employees. Most recently, we printed and distributed 1969 "This Oppresses Women" stickers after reviving them from the Redstockings Archive. We got a lot of publicity when they were used against Protein World's Beach Body ads in Union Square, and they continue to appear on other offending ads all over the city. NWL feminists are also organizing the #ShoutYourAbortion campaign in NYC.

We are a group for women who want to fight back against male supremacy and win more freedom for women. We believe that change comes about from the actions of everyday people—not politicians, the courts, lobbyists, or the media. The freedoms we have now were won by movements of women, organizing and fighting for change. Men did not become less sexist or decide to give women the vote or legalize birth control because of our individual abilities to reason with them, educate them, or because they love us so much. The inequalities between women and men are political problems that require a collective solution.


Check out womensliberation.org to get involved.

Unless specifically noted, all events are for women only. Thank you!
results.name: National Women's Liberation: Feminist Activism NYC
